thread.title: Kenya Airways, Kenya Tourism Board ink deal to boost Kenya tourismTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Kenya Airways, Kenya Tourism Board ink deal to boost Kenya tourismTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Kenya Airways, Kenya Tourism Board ink deal to boost Kenya tourismTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Kenya Airways, Kenya Tourism Board ink deal to boost Kenya tourism Published on : Wednesday, September 9, 2015
In a bid to stimulate the promotion of tourism to Kenya, a memorandum of understanding (MoU) was signed between Kenya Airways and Kenya Tourism Board (KTB).
As per the MoU, both entities will promote tourism growth in the east African country.
Mbuvi Ngunze, chief executive officer of Kenya Airways said the MoU was signed with the ‘desire to strengthen our presence, both as a country and as an airline in key markets around the world.’
He further stated that ‘this MOU covers markets that are important to Kenya, including Nigeria, Uganda, China and France and will therefore strengthen our play in those fields.’
Also, as per the deal Kenya Airways offices will be transformed into “one stop shops” by KTB, where they would provide tourism and visa information as well as ticket processing.
Muriithi Ndegwa, managing director at Kenya Tourism ‘believes its partnership will be able to build the numbers they need to grow tourism.’
The partnership also enables KQ to leverage on KTB’s global marketing platform to increase the number of tourists flying the airline, to and from Kenya.
